revised_title: Magnetic Observations in the Atlantic Ocean and Adjoining Coasts
tldr: The author presents a study of magnetic inclination and intensity observations made at sea in the Atlantic Ocean and its adjoining coasts. The study includes observations by Lieut. Bartholomew James Sullivan and Mr. James Dunlop, and discusses the impact of ship's iron on the results. The author also provides a comparison of onshore and offshore observations, highlighting the importance of proper precautions and techniques in obtaining accurate magnetic data.
